text: Is there any way to merge a vector of dicts (that have the same key) into one dict where the same key has a vector of the corresponding values? I am not able to find how to do this. I looked at this: <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/base/collections/#Dictionaries>

elements.text: Is there any way to merge a vector of dicts (that have the same key) into one dict where the same key has a vector of the corresponding values? I am not able to find how to do this. I looked at this:

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56525| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

Something like
```d = Dict()
for x in xs, (k, v) in x
    push!(get!(d, k, Vector{typeof(v)}()), v)
end```
should do it

elements.text:
d = Dict()
for x in xs, (k, v) in x
    push!(get!(d, k, Vector{typeof(v)}()), v)
end
